name: Ninghui Li
content: Ninghui Li's Homepage Ninghui Li Samuel D. Conte Professor of Computer Science ACM Fellow, IEEE Fellow ninghui@purdue.edu Biographical Information Address Purdue University Department of Computer Sciences 305 N. University Street West Lafayette, Indiana, 47907-2107 Office Phone: +1 765-496-6756 FAX: +1 765-494-0739 Coaching Purdue ICPC Teams On November 10, 2024, Purdue Teams competed in the ICPC North America East Division competition. Purdue Waffle Wizards team (Wilbert Chu, Robert Lee, and Thomas Quintus Marlowe) solved all 13 problems and finished at 3rd place in the combined ranking including all 3 regions in the division, behind CMU and MIT. The team advances to North America Championship. In April, 2024, ICPC held the 46th and 47th World Finals. Purdue Team (Trung Dang, Richard Li, and Devin Qu) competed in the 47th World Final, and Purdue Team (Egor Gagushin, Peter Jin, and Minh Thanh Nguyen) competed in the 46th World Final. On May 29, 2023, Purdue Team (Trung Dang, Richard Li, and Devin Qu) received a Bronze Medal in ICPC North America Championship. Purdue team finished at 4th place. On February 25, 2023, Purdue Team (Trung Dang, Richard Li, and Devin Qu) won ICPC East Central North America Contest, besting teams from CMU, Waterloo, Toronto, Michigan and many other universities in the region. On November 10, 2022, Purdue Team (Riley Borgard, Trung Dang, and Richard Li) finished 20th place in ICPC World Finals Dhaka. Purdue was 4th place among all universities in North America behind MIT, CMU, and Waterloo. On May 30, 2022, Purdue Team (Trung Dang, Minh Nguyen, and Devin Qu) finished 9th place in ICPC North America Championship, and advanced to World Final . On August 14, 2021, Purdue Team (Riley Borgard, Trung Dang, and Richard Li) finished 12th place in ICPC North America Championship, and advanced to World Final Dhaka. On February 23, 2020, Purdue Team (Riley Borgard, Trung Dang, and Yi Xu) won Bronze Medal (4th place) in 2020 North America Championship, and advanced to World Final Moscow. Due to Covid, only Riley attended WF Moscow. Outreach See here for a list of K-12 competition math courses I've taught Learning to Code on the Cloud: Virtual Summer Camps for Middle and High School Students July 2021 ; June 2022 ; July 2023 See here for resources on learning to program See here for some info of grades 3-6 math Current Research Projects SaTC: Frontiers: Center for Distributed Confidential Computing (CDCC) 10/1/2022 to 9/30/2027, (PI of Purdue Portion). Funded by NSF. Collaboration with IU Bloominton, CMU, Duke, Ohio State, Penn State, UNC Chapel Hill, Yale. ACTION: AI Institute for Agent-based Cyber Threat Intelligence and Operation 06/01/2023 to 05/31/2028. Funded by NSF. Collaboration with University of California-Santa Barbara, University of California-Berkeley, Georgia Tech, and other universities Collaborative Proposal: SaTC: CORE: Small: Differentially Private Data Synthesis. 07/15/2023-06/30/2026. Funded by NSF. (PI of Purdue, in collaboration with UCLA) Slides from Recent Talks Private Data Synthesis: State of the Art and Challenges Keynote talk in 2024 Synthetic Data and GenAI Wrokshop Membership Inference Attacks against Classifiers Keynote talk in 2023 IEEE CNS. Differentially Private: Meaning and Caveats Invited talk in AI for Society day in 2023 KDD conference Teaching CS(i+1)90-CPi: Competitive Programming : CP1 and CP2 have been offered every Fall/Spring in recent years. Below are the versions with the most publicly-available resources. See https://purdue.kattis.com/ for problem sets used in recent semesters. CP0: Summer 2020 Offered only once. present), PC Chair (2014 and 2015) SIGSAC Outstanding Early-Career Researcher Award Committee, Chair (2024) ACM SIGSAC Awards Committee, Chair (2023, 2016) ACM Conference on Data and Application Security and Privacy (CODASPY), PC Chair, 2023 and 2024 ACM Transactions on Privacy and Security (TOPS) (Formerlly TISSEC), Editor-in-Chief (October 2020~January 2024) ACM Special Interest Group on Security, Audit and Control (SIGSAC), Member of Executive Committee (July 2021~June 2025), Chair (July 2017~2021), Vice Chair (July 2013~2017) ACM Transactions on Internet Technology (TOIT), Associate Editor (2014~present) European Symposium on Research in Computer Security (ESORICS), PC Chair, 2020 Journal of Computer Security (JCS), Associate Editor (2014~2022) ACM Symposium on Access Control Models and Technologies (SACMAT), , Steering Committee member, (2008-2016) IEEE Transactions on Dependable and Secure Computing, Associate Editor, (2011~2015) ASIACCS: ACM Symposium on Information, Computer and Communications Security, Steering Committee member, (2011-2016) The VLDB Journal, Associate Editor, (2007~2013) On COVID-19 August, 2021: Our paper titled "PURE: A Framework for Analyzing Proximity-based Contact Tracing Protocols" was accepted to appear in ACM Computing Surveys June 29, 2020: I gave a keynote at 2020 IEEE Conference on Communications and Network Security (CNS) titled "COVID-19, Cybersecurity, and Epidemiology". Slides are 		here. Recorded talk is here. April 5, 2020: We Should Learn from Austria's Experiences Fighting COVID-19. Essentially the same version titled: Covid-19, CyberSecurity, and Epidemiology March 14, 2020: Open Letter 2: Aggressive Social Distancing is Everyone's Responsibility PDF version on (Mar 14, 2020) March 9, 2020: Open Letter 1: The Urgent Need for Aggressive Social Distancing Actions PDF version on (Mar 10, 2020) (Mar 11, 2020) This page last modified November 11, 2025.
